headline: Goldman Sachs pares risk after tariff move, braces for more uncertainty
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Goldman Sachs has moderated its risk-taking since U.S. President Donald Trump's April tariff announcement, and the Wall Street bank is braced for more uncertainty, a top executive said.  "We have moderated our risk positioning since April 2nd - I think that's a sensible thing for us to do," Goldman President John Waldron said in a podcast released by the investment bank on Thursday.  Goldman is readying for continued uncertainty in the coming months, which means keeping a greater liquidity cushion, he said.

headline: Goldman Poaches Rivals’ Marketers in Bid to Grow Fund Management Arm
summary: Goldman Sachs  known for its investment bankers and traders, is trying to make a bigger name as a fund manager.  Goldman has laid out targets to generate higher returns and profit margins from its asset and wealth management business, which drove a quarter of the firm’s overall earnings and 30% of revenue last year.  The firm hired Seth Morrison, the former chief marketing officer of financial firm  SEI  as head of marketing for Goldman Sachs Asset Management.
